text:
[Section: Subject: Re: SAAS Reminder: Parent Educa�on event this Monday, January 22nd]



You won’t fucking tell me secret lady! Just like you did not tell me about KO or what I was doing wrong before you blew up
our family. There is no system in the world where someone is convicted without saying what the crimes are so they can
speak to them. This is fucking impossible.
From: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2024 8:06:32 AM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

This completely ignores impact of what happened. You are just not understanding the implications. Talk to Dr. Brown about
this. I am happy to kick off.

Get Outlook for iOS
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2024 8:04:32 AM
To: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

Just stop. I’m not doing anything to you. We are back into the old cycle that happened the last time you took the kids from
me
pre parenting plan.
It puts us in battle stations just like all our therapist said, when you let the lawyers drive our family health decisions. You
did it all of December and have kicked off January the same way.
I don’t want to fight with you. I want to work with you. If you would lay down your sword for a day you could see that. Quit
punching me in the face and expecting not to get a negative response.
Can we just stop? Please! For everyone’s mental health and our longer term fiscal health. I can do it if you can. Let’s smoke
the peace pipe and move on graciously.
From: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2024 7:58:42 AM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Ok. I continue to feel uncomfortable in our interactions both in person and digital.
If I attend I would need to think through how that would work if you are present.

Outlook for iOS

Sent: Thursday, January 18, 2024 7:45:18 AM
To: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

intimate setting I will pass.

Unlocking Understanding:

This Monday, January 22nd,
SPARRC is excited to present Unlocking Understanding:
Exploring the Roots of Bias in the Brain, co-hosted with the

This event features
Missy Widmann, EdD, and Jerome Hunter of Neural Education, Institute for
Connecting Neuroscience with Learning and Education. They will speak about the roots of bias
in the brain, offering us a fascinating opportunity to learn more about the neuroscience behind
biases, particularly racial biases. Please Save the Date and RSVP below.
Event Details:

Parent Education and SPARRC Present:
Exploring the Roots of Bias in the Brain

Middle School Building - Middle School Commons
Parking is available in the Spring St. Garage

Questions? Contact Paul Teske, Family Association Parent Education Committee or Meg

Seattle Academy  |  1201 E Union St.  |  Seattle, WA 98122
Unsubscribe Link

This Monday, January 22nd,

graded pretty quickly yay!

So the thing that I would note is the movers are generally very helpful. They often will swap, mount, and move crap if you
are nice and ask with a "just tell me if you can't". Remember, they are paid by the hour so  if they can get more time in while
they are stationed and not moving they seem to understand the math.
